thing-type.label: FGKF601 Keyfob
thing-type.description: Keyfob<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO KeyFob is a Z-Wave Plus compatible, battery-powered, compact remote control. Six buttons allow you to control other devices through the Z-Wave network and run various scenes defined in FIBARO System. Configure actions for one, two, three clicks, holding the button and button sequences to suit all your needs.</p&gt <p&gtBuilt-in locking system will ensure that unauthorized person will not take control of your home.</p&gt <h1&gtMain features of FIBARO KeyFob:</h1&gt <ul&gt<li&gtCompatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,</li&gt <li&gtSupports Z-Wave network Security Mode with AES-128 encryption,</li&gt <li&gtBattery powered,</li&gt <li&gtCompletely wireless,</li&gt <li&gtPocket size,</li&gt <li&gtEquipped with 6 easily recognizable buttons,</li&gt <li&gt30 different actions, single/double/triple click, hold for each button and sequences,</li&gt <li&gtEasy to operate menu,</li&gt <li&gtActions are confirmed by the built-in LED diode.</li&gt </ul&gt<h1&gtBasic activation</h1&gt <ol&gt<li&gtUsing included keyring or a coin, open the battery cover by turning it counter-clockwise</li&gt <li&gtRemove the sticker protecting the battery.</li&gt <li&gtUsing included keyring or a coin, close the battery cover by turning it clockwise.</li&gt <li&gtLocate the device nearby the main Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main Z-Wave controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtClick any button three times.</li&gt <li&gtLED will pulse white during the adding process.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the device to be added into the system.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and green LED colour.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet the main Z-Wave controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtPower the device (insert the battery).</li&gt <li&gtClick any button three times.</li&gt <li&gtLED will pulse white during the adding process.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and green LED colour.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet the main Z-Wave controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtClick o and - simultaneously.</li&gt <li&gtClick Δ or x until LED glows green.</li&gt <li&gtClick +.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe KeyFob needs to be woken up to receive information about the new configuration from the Z-Wave controller, like parameters and associations. Use 1st menu position (white) or click o and + simultaneously to wake up the device.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_2
parameter.label: 1: Lock Mode - unlocking sequence
parameter.description: 0 - Lock Mode disabled, 9-28086 - unlocking sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to activate Lock Mode and set up unlocking sequence. Device will lock after time set in parameter 2 or after pressing and holding selected button. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_2
parameter.label: 2: Lock Mode - time to lock and locking button
parameter.description: 0 - Lock Mode disabled, 5-1791 - calculated value<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gtThis parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to lock the device and locking button.</li&gt <li&gtSetting locking button will deactivate associations and scenes for pressing and holding the selected button.</li&gt <li&gtThis parameter is irrelevant if parameter 1 is set to 0 (Lock Mode disable).</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_2
parameter.label: 3: First scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 1st sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 7. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_2
parameter.label: 4: Second scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 2nd sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 8.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_2
parameter.label: 5: Third scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 3rd sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 9.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Fourth scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 4th sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 10. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_2
parameter.label: 7: Fifth scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 5th sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 11. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_2
parameter.label: 8: Sixth scene sequence
parameter.description: 0 - 6th sequence disabled, 9-28086 - value of sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 12.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Sequences - timeout
parameter.description: 5-30 (0.5-3s, 0.1s step) - time to lock<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last click of the button to check if the sequence is valid.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Single button associations - operating mode
parameter.description: This parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations. </p&gt</p&gt

options.option: single click switches state to opposite
single click => opposite, double click => max
single click turns on, double click turns off

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Value sent to □ association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Value sent to ○ association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: Value sent to x association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_2
parameter.label: 14: Value sent to Δ association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_2
parameter.label: 15: Value sent to - association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_2
parameter.label: 16: Value sent to + association group
parameter.description: 1-99 or 255 (last state)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.</p&gt <p&gt1-99 - forcing level of associated devices<br /&gt255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Paired buttons association for □ and ○
parameter.description: activate paired buttons association mode for □ and ○ buttons<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for □ and ○ buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to □ groups. ○ turns devices on and increases value, □ turns them off and decreases value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: Paired buttons association for x and Δ
parameter.description: allows to activate paired buttons association mode for x and Δ buttons<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for x and Δ buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to x groups. Δ turns devices on and increases value, x turns them off and decreases value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Paired buttons association for - and +
parameter.description: allows to activate paired buttons association mode for - and + buttons<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for - and + buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to - groups. + turns devices on and increases value, - turns them off and decreases value. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Scene activation for □ button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Scene activation for ○ button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_23_1
parameter.label: 23: Scene activation for x button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Scene activation for Δ button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Scene activation for - button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: Scene activation for + button
parameter.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 - Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 - Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 - Key held down &amp; released</p&gt <p&gtCombine multiple actions by combining the values.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_29_2
parameter.label: 29: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameter.description: defines how commands are sent in specified association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: using Security Mode or not. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st “Lifeline” association group.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt1 - 2nd group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt2 - 3rd group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt4 - 4th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt8 - 5th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt16 - 6th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt32 - 7th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt64 - 8th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt128 - 9th group sent using Security Mode <br /&gt256 - 10th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt512 - 11th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt1024 - 12th group sent using Security Mode<br /&gt2048 - 13th group sent using Security Mode</p&gt <p&gtSet multiple values by combining the values together.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Square - On/Off
parameter.description: “Square - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the □ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Square - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Square - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the □ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Circle - On/Off
parameter.description: “Circle - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the ○ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Circle - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Circle - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the ○ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Cross - On/Off
parameter.description: “Cross - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the x button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_7
parameter.label: 7: Cross - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Cross - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the x button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

parameter.name: group_8
parameter.label: 8: Triangle - On/Off
parameter.description: “Triangle - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the Δ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_9
parameter.label: 9: Triangle - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Triangle - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the Δ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

parameter.name: group_10
parameter.label: 10: Minus - On/Off
parameter.description: “Minus - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the - button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_11
parameter.label: 11: Minus - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Minus - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the - button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

parameter.name: group_12
parameter.label: 12: Plus - On/Off
parameter.description: “Plus - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the + button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

parameter.name: group_13
parameter.label: 13: Plus - Multilevel
parameter.description: “Plus - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the + button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.
